name: $subunit
desc: Returns: Index of linear sequences of nucleic acids in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Index of linear sequences of nucleic acids in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts.

name: $sequence
desc: Returns: Actual nucleotide sequence notation from 5' to 3' end using standard single letter codes. In addition to the base sequence, sugar and type of phosphate or non-phosphate linkage should also be captured.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Actual nucleotide sequence notation from 5' to 3' end using standard single letter codes. In addition to the base sequence, sugar and type of phosphate or non-phosphate linkage should also be captured.

name: $length
desc: Returns: The length of the sequence shall be captured.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The length of the sequence shall be captured.

name: $fivePrime
desc: Returns: The nucleotide present at the 5’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5’ prime nucleotide is the letter at the first position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The nucleotide present at the 5’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5’ prime nucleotide is the letter at the first position in the sequence. A separate representat

name: $threePrime
desc: Returns: The nucleotide present at the 3’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5’ prime nucleotide is the letter at the last position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The nucleotide present at the 3’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5’ prime nucleotide is the letter at the last position in the sequence. A separate representati

name: $linkage
desc: Returns: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured.

name: $addlinkage
desc: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured.
